chapter.title: Platypus Application Designer
chapter.para: The application designer software package is included into the developer's kit and can be bundled with the Platypus Platform runtime installation.
The developer's kit may be supplied:

listitem.para: as an installer archive which can be downloaded from the Internet.

chapter.para: If the developer's kit is supplied as an archive, unpack its contents to the folder of your choice on the hard drive.

note.para: Platypus Platform runtime installation instructions are provided in the Administration Guide.

section.title: System requirements
section.para:
System requirements for installing the developer's kit on a computer includes:
32-bit (x86) or 64-bit (x64) CPU, 1 GHz or above
2 GB (for 32-bit system) or 3 GB (for 64-bit system) RAM
10 GB of free disk space
Operating system with graphical user interface: Windows or Linux
Oracle JDK 7
Internet access for updates downloading

section.title: Installation guide
section.para:
To install the developer's kit, perform the following actions:
Launch the platypusdesigner-windows.exe file for Windows OS or platypusdesigner-linux.sh for Linux.
For Linux OS, the user must have access rights enabling to launch the executable file.
Click Next to proceed to the next installation step.
Read licensing terms and conditions; check the I accept the terms of the license agreement option to accept; click Next to proceed to the next step.
Select the applications installation directory and options for creating shortcuts on the desktop and in the installed programs menu; click Next to proceed to the next step.
Click Install to begin the Platypus Application Designer installation process.
After the installation process is finished, click Finish; check the Launch Platypus application designer after the installer closes option to launch the designer.

note.para: Specify the path to the JDK in the jdkhome parameter in the Platypus Application Designer configuration file at platypusdesigner/etc/platypusdesigner.conf, if the its installation location is other than default. Incorrect value of the jdkhome parameter can lead to errors which may occur when launching the designer.

section.para:
To remove Platypus Application Designer from you computer, perform the following actions:
Use the your OS standard mechanism of programs removal, as an alternative, use the uninstall.exe program for Windows or uninstall.sh for Linux from the installation directory.
Confirm the components removal by clicking Finish button; if necessary, select the option of removing configuration data from the user's directory.

section.title: Configuration tips
section.para: Platypus Application Designer supports localization of menus, messages texts, etc. Currently, the following languages are supported:
The localization language is selected automatically when you launch the application designer according to the regional settings of the operating system.
To force the change of the localization language:

listitem.para: Edit the Platypus Application Designer configuration file — append the default_options parameter with the --locale ru:RU or --locale en:US option.

section.para: You can also change the application designer localization language by adding the --locale ru:RU or --locale en:US option to the command line for launching the Platypus Application Designer.

Platypus Application Designer supports connection of the various user interface Look and Feel (LaF). There are LaFs for specific operating systems, universal styles (Metal and Nimbus), and LaFs which can be supplied by third-party developers.
To change the Application Designer LaF:

listitem.para: Edit the designer configuration file — append the default_options parameter with the --laf LaF option, where LaF corresponds to the name of LaF or full name of the LaF class. If the third-party LaF is used, it is also necessary to include the style library into the path which can be accessed by the Application Designer classloader.

section.title: Runtime environment setup
section.para: The Platypus Platform runtime is required to start, debug and deploy applications. You must specify the path to the runtime directory for the Platypus Application Designer to be able to run and debug your applications.
Specify the location of the Platypus Platform runtime directory in the computer's file system:

listitem.para: Select Tools Platypus Platform in the main menu.
In the selection dialog, specify path to the Platypus Platform directory.

section.para: Add the J2EE server instance which can be used to launch the Platypus application:

listitem.para: In the Services window of the Servers node context menu select the Add server... item.
In the J2EE server adding wizard, select the server type, server name, and specify its preferences: path to the server directory, administrator's login and password.

note.para: The current version of Platypus Application Designer supports launching of applications in Apache Tomcat 7. Download Apache Tomcat 7 from the developer's site and unpack it in the directory of your choice on your hard drive.
